intro: Elleanthus gracilis, commonly known as the slender elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its delicate, elongated leaves and small yellow flowers. Elleanthus gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
